name: Zero-Knowledge Machine Learning for Autonomous Worlds
description:
This talk will chart into the subtle but significant ways that zero-knowledge machine learning (ZKML) can be harnessed to create richer Autonomous Worlds. Three case studies will be presented:

1. Developing standalone games where the ZKML model acts as the game world itself.
2. Using ZKML to generate a world's lore and narrative.
3. Employing ZKML to establish ""onchain physics"" where the model sets the world's state.

The session will be accompanied by a hands-on workshop guiding participants through development and deployment.

speakers.name: Dante
speakers.bio: Dante is currently building EZKL, a library for zero-knowledge computation. In the past, he was a dusty academic studying neural networks.
